channel.title: Why find a color?
channel.description:
Ok this is a theory I just came up with and the way I am going to put it to you is this. We use findcolortolerence in scar, but could someone here (I really don't know if this is possible) change colours via windows. What I am getting at is that instead of finding changing colours couldn't someone here use their programming knowlege to make runescape appear with very direct colours. The bank symbol could be a bright yellow, the mage shop could be made a bright red.
If someone would look into this, or right it off completely in my head ;) Norrisemoe

item.title: Why find a color?
item.dc:creator: @norrisemoe norrisemoe
item.description:
@norrisemoe wrote:

oh cheers, i didnt realise

Read full topic

item.title: Why find a color?
item.dc:creator: @norrisemoe norrisemoe
item.description:
@norrisemoe wrote:

Cheers for the inlook guys! I just started writing a very complex script this is the only reason why i thought of such a thing. It is possible to get around the issue of text, i may have not explained myself very clearly. But ty anyway!

Read full topic

item.title: Why find a color?
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

moparisthebest:

Try changing your color bit depth to something like 8 bit, that substantially lowers the amount of colors runescape can work with, and would certainly improve the ability(or ease) to find colors.

Oh ya! Freddy needs to add that, a function that allows you to search at a different pixel format. Wouldn’t be too hard. But would be no good for things like corner text reading.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic

item.title: Why find a color?
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

I interpret the colors of the corner text before reading it so I don’t have to keep checking tolerance. But most other situations it’d just make things go a lot slower to do that.

Read full topic

item.title: Why find a color?
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

That’s some of the idea behind ScarScape (see Runescape cheating board). Since Runescape actually does change colors randomly, ScarScape removes that so Scar is more effective.

Read full topic
